intro: Lysanthe cana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five distinct petals. Lysanthe cana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
